ui

Class UserHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.UserHandler

  • public class UserHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the program flow associated with user-login. In between login and logout it calls executes the proper UseCaseHandler, depending on which user has logged in.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserHandler(UIFacade UIFacade, UserBook userBook, java.util.ArrayList<UseCaseHandler> handlers)
      Creates a new UserHandler.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      User getCurrentUser()
      Method that returns the user who has completed the login-process.
      void login()
      Assign an existing user to the current user (identify the existing user by the name the user gives), or create a new user with the given name and assign that user to the current user.
      void logOut()
      Set the currentUser to null, indicating there is currently no user logged in.
      void performDuties()
      Have the user execute the use case he has the authorization to execute.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserHandler

        public UserHandler(UIFacade UIFacade,
           UserBook userBook,
           java.util.ArrayList<UseCaseHandler> handlers)
            throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Creates a new UserHandler.
        Parameters:
        UIFacade - The UIfacade this UserHandler has to use to communicate with the user.
        userBook - The UserBook this Userhandler uses to complete the login-process.
        handlers - An ArrayList containing all the UseCaseHandlers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if one of the given arguments is null.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentUser

        public User getCurrentUser()
        Method that returns the user who has completed the login-process.

      • login

        public void login()
        Assign an existing user to the current user (identify the existing user by the name the user gives), or create a new user with the given name and assign that user to the current user.

      • performDuties

        public void performDuties()
        Have the user execute the use case he has the authorization to execute.
        Throws:
        java.io.InvalidObjectException - If the user doesn't have authorization to execute any of the use cases.

      • logOut

        public void logOut()
        Set the currentUser to null, indicating there is currently no user logged in.
